name: Mild Black Bean & Rice Stuffed Peppers
description: Bell peppers baked with a mild Latin/Mexican black bean, tomato, corn, and rice filling. Comforting and family-friendly with bright lime and coriander.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 cup jasmine rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Halve 4 bell peppers lengthwise and remove seeds and membranes.
Dice 1 onion and mince 2 cloves garlic.
Rinse and drain black beans; measure corn.
Halve the lime; chop coriander leaves.
cook_steps: Add 2 cups water and the rinsed jasmine rice to a pot; bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer until tender, 12–15 minutes. Rest covered 5 minutes.
While rice cooks, brush or rub bell pepper halves with 1 tsp olive oil, place cut-side up on a baking tray, and bake 10 minutes to soften. Remove and set aside.
Heat 2 tsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion until translucent, 4–5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Stir in 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and 1 tsp salt; cook 30 seconds to bloom spices.
Add diced tomatoes, black beans, and corn. Simmer 5–7 minutes to thicken slightly.
Fold the cooked rice into the skillet mixture. Squeeze in half the lime and adjust salt to taste.
Spoon filling into the pre-baked bell pepper halves. Return to the oven and bake 15–20 minutes until peppers are tender and filling is hot.
Finish with chopped coriander and remaining lime wedges for serving.
